questions.question: Which Question Paper Type of Physics is given to you?
questions.explanation: The header in the image clearly states "PAPER TYPE: D".

questions.question: When a brick is taken from the earth’s surface to the moon, its mass
questions.explanation: Mass is independent of location; only weight changes with the gravitational field.

questions.question: The resultant of two forces is 50 N. If the forces are perpendicular to each other and one of them makes an angle of 30° with the resultant, find its magnitude.
questions.explanation: Let the force be F and resultant be R. If F makes angle 30° with R, then \(F = R\cos 30^\circ\). So \(F = 50\times\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \approx 43.3\,N\).

questions.question: The pair of physical quantities that are scalar only are
questions.explanation: Volume and area are scalars. Moment (torque), momentum, displacement and impulse are vectors.

questions.question: A simple pendulum of length 0.4 m has a period of 2 s. What is the period a similar pendulum of length 0.8 m at the same place?
questions.explanation: For a pendulum, \(T\propto \sqrt{L}\). So \(T_2=T_1\sqrt{\frac{0.8}{0.4}}=2\sqrt{2}\,s\).

questions.question: A train with an initial velocity of 20 m s\(^{-1}\) is subjected to a uniform deceleration of 2 m s\(^{-2}\). The time required to bring the train to a complete halt is
Calculate the apparent weight loss of a man weighing 70 kg in an elevator moving downwards with an acceleration of 1.5 m s\(^{-2}\). [\(g\approx 10\,m s^{-2}\)]
questions.explanation: Apparent weight (normal reaction) is \(N=m(g-a)=70(10-1.5)=595\,N\). (The printed phrase “apparent weight loss” conflicts with the options; the computed apparent weight matches option B.)

questions.question: A piece of cork floats in a liquid. What fraction of its volume will be immersed in the liquid? [Density of the cork = \(0.25\times 10^3\,kg m^{-3}\); density of the liquid = \(1.25\times 10^3\,kg m^{-3}\)]
questions.explanation: For floating equilibrium: fraction immersed \(=\rho_{cork}/\rho_{liquid}=(0.25\times 10^3)/(1.25\times 10^3)=0.2\).

questions.question: An object is moving with a velocity of 5 m s\(^{-1}\). At what height must a similar body be situated to have a potential energy equal in value with kinetic energy of the moving body?
questions.explanation: Set \(mgh = \tfrac12 mv^2\Rightarrow h=\frac{v^2}{2g}=\frac{25}{20}=1.25\,m\approx 1.3\,m\).

questions.question: If a pump is capable of lifting 5000 kg of water through a vertical height of 60 m in 15 min, the power of the pump is
questions.explanation: Work \(W=mgh=5000\times 10\times 60=3.0\times 10^6\,J\). Time \(t=15\,min=900\,s\). Power \(P=W/t=3.0\times 10^6/900\approx 3.3\times 10^3\,W\).

questions.question: The coefficient of friction between two perfectly smooth surface is
questions.explanation: Perfectly smooth implies no friction, so coefficient is 0.

questions.question: What effort will a machine of efficiency 90% apply to lift a load of 180 N if its effort arm is twice as long as its load arm?
questions.explanation: Velocity ratio \(VR=2\). Efficiency \(\eta=\frac{MA}{VR}\Rightarrow MA=\eta\,VR=0.9\times 2=1.8\). Effort \(E=\frac{L}{MA}=\frac{180}{1.8}=100\,N\).

questions.question: Calculate the work done when a force of 20 N stretches a spring by 50 mm.
questions.explanation: Work in stretching a spring: \(W=\tfrac12 Fx\). With \(F=20\,N\), \(x=0.05\,m\): \(W=\tfrac12\times 20\times 0.05=0.5\,J\).

questions.question: At what depth below the sea-level would one experience a change of pressure equal to one atmosphere? [Density of sea water = \(10^3\,kg m^{-3}\); one atmosphere = \(0.01\times 10^5\,N m^{-2}\); \(g=10\,m s^{-2}\)]
questions.explanation: Use \(\Delta P=\rho gh\Rightarrow h=\frac{\Delta P}{\rho g}=\frac{0.01\times 10^5}{10^3\times 10}=\frac{1000}{10000}=0.1\,m\).

questions.question: What volume of alcohol will have same mass as 4.2 m\(^3\) of petrol?
questions.explanation: The required densities of petrol and alcohol are not shown in the provided image; without densities, the volume of alcohol cannot be computed.

questions.question: Calculate the length which corresponds to a temperature of 20°C if the used steam points of an ungraduated thermometer are 400 mm apart.
questions.explanation: Linear scale: 0–100°C corresponds to 400 mm. For 20°C: \(\frac{20}{100}\times 400=80\,mm\).

questions.question: A wire of length 100.0 m at 30°C has linear expansivity of \(2\times 10^{-5}\,K^{-1}\). Calculate the length of the wire at a temperature of -10°C.
questions.explanation: Temperature drop \(\Delta T=-40\,K\). \(\Delta L=\alpha L\Delta T=(2\times 10^{-5})(100)(-40)=-0.08\,m\). New length = 99.92 m.

questions.question: A gas at a pressure of \(10^5\,N m^{-2}\) expands from 0.6 m\(^3\) to 1.2 m\(^3\) at constant temperature, the work done is
questions.explanation: Using the only computable work expression from given data: \(W=P\Delta V\) with \(P=10^5\) and \(\Delta V=0.6\): \(W=10^5\times 0.6=6.0\times 10^4\,J\). (Note: true isothermal work requires \(n\) and uses \(nRT\ln(V_2/V_1)\), which are not provided.)

questions.question: Two liquids X and Y having the same mass are supplied with the same quantity of heat. If the temperature rise in X is twice that of Y, the ratio of specific heat capacity of X to that of Y is
questions.explanation: Since \(Q=mc\Delta T\) and Q,m same, \(c\propto 1/\Delta T\). If \(\Delta T_X=2\Delta T_Y\), then \(c_X=\tfrac{1}{2}c_Y\Rightarrow 1:2\).

questions.question: Foods cook quicker in salt water than in pure water because of the effect of

options.text: dissolved substances on the boiling point
atmospheric pressure on the boiling point
food nutrients on the thermal energy
salts on the thermal conductivity of water

questions.explanation: Salt raises boiling point (boiling point elevation), allowing higher cooking temperature.

questions.question: Steam from boiling water causes more damage on the skin than does boiling water because

options.text: water has a high specific heat
steam has latent heat of fusion
the steam is at higher temperature than the water
steam brings heat more easily by convection

questions.explanation: Physically correct reason: steam releases latent heat of vaporization upon condensing on the skin. None of the options states this (option B incorrectly says latent heat of fusion). Therefore no option accurately matches the correct explanation.

questions.question: What will happen to the boiling point of pure water when it is heated in a place 30 m below sea level?
questions.explanation: Below sea level, atmospheric pressure is higher, increasing boiling point.

questions.question: The rise or fall of liquid in a narrow tube is because of the

options.text: friction between the walls of the tube and the liquid

questions.explanation: Capillary action is due to surface tension (and adhesion).

questions.question: The mechanism of heat transfer from one point to another through the vibration of the molecules of the medium is
questions.explanation: Conduction occurs by molecular vibration/collisions without bulk movement.

questions.question: A wave travels through stretched strings is known as
questions.explanation: Waves on strings require a medium → mechanical.

questions.question: A transverse wave and a longitudinal wave travelling in the same direction in a medium differ essentially in their

options.text: direction of vibration of the particles of the medium
period of vibration of the particles of the medium

questions.explanation: Transverse: vibration ⟂ propagation; longitudinal: vibration ∥ propagation.

questions.question: What is the velocity of sound at 100°C, if the velocity of sound at 0°C is 340 m s^-1?
questions.explanation: Using \(v\propto\sqrt{T}\): \(v_2=340\sqrt{\frac{373}{273}}\approx 397\,m s^{-1}\).

questions.question: If a sonometer has a fundamental frequency of 450 Hz, what is the frequency of the fifth overtone?
questions.explanation: 5th overtone = 6th harmonic = \(6\times 450=2700\,Hz\).

questions.question: A man 1.5 m tall is standing 3 m in front of a pinhole camera whose distance between the hole and the screen is 0.1 m. What is the height of the image of the man on the screen?
questions.explanation: Similar triangles: \(\frac{h_i}{h_o}=\frac{v}{u}=\frac{0.1}{3}\). \(h_i=1.5\times\frac{0.1}{3}=0.05\,m\).

questions.question: A ray of light passing through the centre of curvature of a concave mirror is reflected by the mirror at
questions.explanation: It strikes normally and retraces its path, so incidence angle is 0°.

questions.question: From the diagram below, calculate the incident angle i.
questions.explanation: Snell’s law requires both indices and either incident or refracted angle. While n values are shown (1.52 and 1.33), the necessary angle marking is not legible in the provided image, so i cannot be computed reliably.

questions.question: Total internal reflection will not occur when light travels from
questions.explanation: TIR requires travel from denser to less dense. Water→glass is less→more dense, so TIR cannot occur.

questions.explanation: The diagram is too unclear to confidently distinguish microscope vs telescope and normal vs abnormal adjustment from the uploaded image.

questions.question: If the linear magnification of the objective and eyepiece convex lenses of a compound microscope are 4 and 7 respectively, calculate the angular magnification of the microscope.
questions.explanation: Total magnification = objective magnification × eyepiece magnification = \(4\times 7=28\).

questions.question: The angle of deviation of light of various colours passing through a triangular prism increases in the order
questions.explanation: Deviation increases with refractive index; red deviates least and blue/violet more. The given increasing order among the listed is red → green → blue.

questions.question: Calculate the force acting on an electron of charge \(1.5\times 10^{-19}\,C\) placed in an electric field of intensity \(10^5\,V m^{-1}\).
Capacitors are used in the induction coil to
questions.explanation: They reduce sparking at the contact breaker by absorbing induced emf.

questions.question: A cell of emf 1.5 V is connected in series with a 1 Ω resistor and a current of 0.3 A flows through the resistor. Find the internal resistance of the cell.
questions.explanation: Total resistance \(R+r=\frac{E}{I}=\frac{1.5}{0.3}=5\,\Omega\). With external \(R=1\,\Omega\), internal \(r=5-1=4\,\Omega\).

questions.question: Which of the following obeys ohms law?
questions.explanation: Metals behave approximately ohmically (linear V–I) at constant temperature.

questions.question: A house has ten 40 W and five 100 W bulbs. How much will it cost the owner of the house to keep them lit for 10 hours if the cost of a unit is N5?
questions.explanation: Total power \(P=10\times 40 + 5\times 100 = 900\,W = 0.9\,kW\). Energy in 10 h: \(E=0.9\times 10 = 9\,kWh\). Cost = \(9\times 5 = N45\).

questions.question: An electric device is rated 2000 W, 250 V. Calculate the maximum current it can take.
questions.explanation: Current \(I=\frac{P}{V}=\frac{2000}{250}=8\,A\).

questions.question: When a charge moves through an electric circuit in the direction of an electric force, it ____

options.text: gains both potential and kinetic energy
gains potential energy and kinetic energy
loses potential energy and gains kinetic energy
loses both potential and kinetic energy

questions.explanation: A charge moving along the electric force moves to lower potential, so electrical potential energy decreases and converts to kinetic energy (then dissipates).

questions.question: To convert a galvanometer to voltmeter, a ____

options.text: high resistance is connected to it in series
high resistance is connected to it in parallel
low resistance is connected to it in series
low resistance is connected to it in parallel

questions.explanation: A large series resistor limits current so the galvanometer can measure voltage.

questions.question: Induced emfs are best explained using
questions.explanation: Faraday’s law gives \(\mathcal{E} = -\frac{d\Phi}{dt}\), explaining induced emf quantitatively.

questions.question: If a current of 2.5 A flows through an electrolyte for 3 hours and 1.8 g of a substance is deposited, what is the mass of the substance that will be deposited if a current of 4 A flows through it for 4.8 hours?
questions.explanation: Since \(m\propto It\): \(m_2 = 1.8\times\frac{4\times 4.8}{2.5\times 3}=1.8\times 2.56=4.608\,g\approx 4.6\,g\).

questions.question: Calculate the energy of the third level of an atom if the ground state energy is -24 eV
questions.explanation: Using \(E_n=\frac{E_1}{n^2}\): \(E_3=-\frac{24}{9}=-2.67\,eV\). None of the options equals -2.67 eV; the closest is -2.75 eV (C), but the exact value from the given ground state energy is -2.67 eV.

questions.question: In photo-emission, the number of photoelectrons ejected per second depends on the ____
questions.explanation: For frequency above threshold, emission rate depends on photon flux (intensity).

questions.question: The particle nature of light is demonstrated by the
questions.explanation: Photoelectric effect requires quantized photons.

questions.question: The energy of a photon having a wavelength of \(10^{-10}\,m\) is (\(h = 6.63\times 10^{-34}\,J s\), \(c = 3.0\times 10^8\,m s^{-1}\))
questions.explanation: Photon energy \(E=\frac{hc}{\lambda}=\frac{(6.63\times 10^{-34})(3.0\times 10^8)}{10^{-10}}=1.989\times 10^{-15}\,J\approx 2.0\times 10^{-15}\,J\).

questions.question: The bond between silicon and germanium is ____
questions.explanation: Si and Ge are Group 14 elements; bonding between them is by electron sharing (covalent).
